Author: Nation-state threat actors
Target: Organizations in the United States, the Middle East, and Africa
Description: Researchers from Palo Alto Networks discover a threat activity cluster, named CL-STA-0002, carried out via a novel malware named 'Agent Raccoon' (or Agent Racoon) used in cyberattacks against organizations in the United States, the Middle East, and Africa.

Researchers at Wordfence and PatchStack discover a campaign emailing WordPress administrators with fake WordPress security advisories for a fictitious vulnerability tracked as CVE-2023-45124 to infect sites with a malicious plugin.

The Hershey Company, the American manufacturer of popular sweets such as Kit Kat and Reese's Peanut Butter Cups, tells regulators that more than 2,200 people were potentially affected by a data breach after hackers gained access to some of the company’s email accounts.

Author: Storm-0216 (a.k.a. Twisted Spider and UNC2198)
Description: Researchers from Microsoft reveal that the threat actor Storm-0216 (a.k.a. Twisted Spider and UNC2198) is using the Danabot malware distributed through online advertisements to infect victims with the Cactus ransomware.

Author: Cyber Av3ngers
Target: Four water utilities and an aquarium in the U.S.
Description: The FBI, the Environmental Protection Agency, the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency, (CISA,) and Israel’s National Cyber Directorate reveal that at least four water utilities and an aquarium in the U.S. have been targeted by the Iranian hacktivists from the Cyber Av3ngers targeting vulnerable Unitronics controllers.

Author: Cuba
Description: Rock County issues notification letters about a Cuba ransomware attack and data breach that affected 25,823 individuals.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Medusa
Description: The Medusa ransomware gang claims to have hit Great Valley School District in Pennsylvania.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: Pacific Cataract and Laser Institute is hit with a LockBit 3.0 ransomware attack.

Author: Qilin
Description: A new version of the Qilin ransomware is discovered targeting VMware ESXi systems.

Author: Forest Blizzard a.k.a. APT28, Fancy Bear, Strontium, Fighting Ursa, TA422, ITG05
Target: Government, energy, transportation, and other key organizations in the United States, Europe, and the Middle East.
Description: Microsoft's Threat Intelligence team issues a warning about the Russian state-sponsored actor APT28 (aka "Fancy Bear" or "Strontium") actively exploiting the CVE-2023-23397 Outlook vulnerability to hijack Microsoft Exchange accounts and steal sensitive information.

Author: P2Pinfect
Description: Researchers from Cado discover a new variant of the P2Pinfect botnet, focusing on infecting devices with 32-bit MIPS processors, such as routers and IoT devices.

Author: ALPHV a.k.a. BlackCat
Description: Accounting software giant Tipalti says it is investigating reports of a ransomware attack after the BlackCat/ALPHV ransomware gang spent the weekend attempting to extort the company and its customers.

Author: Malek Team
Description: Malek Team, a group allegedly linked to Iran, claims to have leaked thousands of medical records from Ziv Medical Center, an Israeli hospital, including those of Israeli soldiers.

Author: Cyber Av3ngers
Target: St. Johns River Water Management District
Description: St. Johns River Water Management District, a regulatory agency in Florida that oversees the long-term supply of drinking water, confirms that it responded to a cyberattack after the Cyber Av3ngers said it attacked the organization, providing samples of what it stole.
The St. Landry Parish Schools district is hit with a ransomware attack.

Author: HelloKitty?
Description: The Hermon School Department suffers a ransomware attack after the threat actors exploit the CVE-2023-46604 Apache ActiveMQ vulnerability,
Taylor University notifies individuals whose information may have been impacted by a ransomware attack discovered in May.

Author: Threat actors linked to Russia and China
Target: Sellafield Nuclear Waste and Decommissioning Site
Description: Threat actors linked to Russia and China have allegedly hacked into the systems of the Sellafield nuclear waste and decommissioning site in the UK, according to an investigation conducted by The Guardian. However, the British government has dismissed the reports.
Researchers from Cyble discover a new variant of the TrickMo banking trojan, using an overlay attack technique.
Sharonview Federal Credit Union (Sharonview) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access an employee’s email account.
Neurosurgical Associates of New Jersey (Neurosurgeons of New Jersey) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party accessed an employee’s email account.

Author: Akira
Description: The American division of the Chinese multinational Hangzhou Great Star Industrial Co., Ltd (Great Star), pays a ransom of 1 million dollars in a BTC wallet to the Akira ransomware group.

Author: SpyLoan
Target: Android users in Mexico, India, Thailand, Indonesia, Nigeria, Philippines, Egypt, Vietnam, Singapore, Kenya, Colombia, and Peru.
Description: Researchers from ESET discover more than a dozen malicious loan apps, generically named SpyLoan, downloaded more than 12 million times.
Country: CO EG ID IN KE MX NG PE PH SG TH VN

Target: Two federal agencies in the U.S.
Description: The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) warns about threat actors actively exploiting a critical vulnerability in Adobe ColdFusion identified as CVE-2023-26360 to gain initial access to government servers.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: ALPHV a.k.a. BlackCat
Description: IT services and business consulting company HTC Global Services confirms they suffered a cyberattack after the ALPHV/BlackCat ransomware gang begins leaking screenshots of stolen data, allegedly obtained exploiting the CVE-2023-4966 Citrixbleed vulnerability.
Japanese car maker Nissan investigates a cyberattack that targeted its systems in Australia and New Zealand, which may have let hackers access personal information.

Author: Doppelgänger
Description: Researchers from Recorded Future discover additional activity from the Russia-linked ‘Doppelgänger’ social media operation targeting Ukraine.

Author: Doppelgänger
Description: Researchers from Recorded Future discover another campaign from the Russia-linked ‘Doppelgänger’ social media operation targeting Germany and the U.S.

Author: Andariel
Target: South Korean companies connected to the defense industry
Description: The Seoul Metropolitan Police accuses the North Korean group Andariel of targeting South Korean companies connected to the defense industry and stealing 1.2 terabytes of sensitive information about anti-aircraft weapon systems.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Andariel
Target: Three organizations in South Korea and abroad
Description: Separately, the Seoul Metropolitan Police investigators discover that the group extorted three ransomware victims in South Korea and abroad for about $357,000 worth of Bitcoin.
Researchers from Abnormal Security discover a sophisticated, personalized, phishing attack impersonating Disney+

Author: Chinese Threat Actors
Description: Researchers from Bolster discover a widespread phishing campaign, using a domain impersonating Walmart, and cleverly designed to mimic the appearance of the USPS.com website.

Author: Doppelganger
Target: Individuals in Germany, Ukraine, and the U.S.
Description: Researchers from Recorded Future discover a new campaign by the Russia-linked influence operation called Doppelganger, aimed to amplify content designed to undermine Ukraine as well as propagate anti-LGBTQ+ sentiment, U.S. military competence, and Germany's economic and social issues.

Author: Forest Blizzard a.k.a. APT28, Fancy Bear, Strontium, Fighting Ursa, TA422, ITG05
Target: Organizations in Europe and North America
Description: Researchers from Proofpoint discover a new campaign by the Russian threat actor APT28 exploiting the CVE-2023-23397 Microsoft Outlook vulnerability and CVE-2023-38831 WinRAR vulnerability.

Author: BlackSuit
Description: The Groveport Madison Schools is hit with a BlackSuit ransomware attack.
Advantis Global files a notice of data breach after discovering a “security incident” involving its corporate email system.

Author: Clop a.k.a. Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: 1st Source Bank confirms that the protected health information of 1,477 individuals was stolen in May 2023 when hackers exploited the zero day vulnerability in Progress Software’s MOVEit Transfer solution.
4 Over  provides notice of a data security incident. after detecting suspicious activity affecting systems within the network.
Dameron Hospital reschedules some procedures after suffering a cyberattack,
Hi-School Pharmacy discloses a ransomware attack.
Rappler, a digital media company in the Philippines, is hit by a massive series of crippling DDoS attacks.
Manchester Public Schools lose $180K after making three payments, totaling roughly $180,000, to a potentially fraudulent bank account after a vendor was hacked.

Author: Hunters International
Description: Austal USA, a shipbuilding company and a contractor for the U.S. Department of Defense (DoD) and the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) confirms it suffered a cyberattack and is currently investigating the impact of the incident, after the Hunters International ransomware and data extortion group claimed to have breached Austal USA and leaked some information as proof of the intrusion.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: The LockBit 3.0 ransomware gang add La Prensa to the list of their victims.

Author: Medusa
Description: The Campbell County School District is listed in the leak site of the Medusa ransomware gang.
Researchers from Kaspersky discover  several cracked applications distributed by unauthorized websites and loaded with a Trojan-Proxy targeting MacOS, Windows, and Android users.

Author: Akira
Description: The Akira ransomware gang adds Compass Group Italia to the list of their victims.

Author: Akira
Description: The Akira ransomware gang adds Aqualectra Holdings to the list of their victims.
Researchers from AhnLab discover a new campaign distributing the AsyncRAT in WSF script format.
United Home Loans (UHL) files a notice of data breach after discovering that what appeared to be suspicious activity on its computer network turned out to be a cyberattack.

Author: DragonForce
Target: Heart of Texas Behavioral Health Network
Description: Heart of Texas Behavioral Health Network (HOTBHN) notifies certain current and former patients that their personal information may have been accessed as part of cyber security incident.

Author: Clop a.k.a. Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: CBIZ KA, a revenue cycle management vendor is affected by a MOVEit breach. Nine of Ontario Prime Healthcare's hospitals are affected.
Eye Physicians of Central Florida announces that the protected health information of 31,189 patients was exposed and potentially stolen in a recent cyberattack.
Researchers from Group-IB discover a remote access trojan named Krasue, targeting Linux systems of telecommunications companies predominantly in Thailand, and managed to remain undetected since 2021.

Author: Callisto Group a.k.a. Seaborgium or Star Blizzard
Description: The UK National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) and Microsoft, together with multiple agencies, warn that the Russian state-backed actor "Callisto Group" (aka "Seaborgium" or "Star Blizzard") is targeting organizations worldwide with spear-phishing campaigns used to steal account credentials and data.

Author: Forest Blizzard a.k.a. APT28, Fancy Bear, Strontium, Fighting Ursa, TA422, ITG05
Target: At least 30 organizations within 14 NATO countries
Description: Researchers from Palo Alto Networks reveal that Russian APT28 military hackers used the Microsoft Outlook CVE-2023-23397 zero-day vulnerability to target multiple European NATO member countries, including a NATO Rapid Deployable Corps.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: Billion-dollar shoe seller Aldo says that a recent claim by the notorious LockBit ransomware gang was related to one of the company’s franchise partners.

Author: Russia-aligned group
Description: Researchers from Microsoft discover an anti-Ukraine propaganda campaign by a Russia-aligned group, manipulating videos of well-known American actors to spread a message that Ukraine's president is a “corrupt drug addict.”

Author: Play
Description: The Play ransomware gang lists the Greater Richmond Transit Company (GRTC) in their leak site.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) adds CVE-2023-41265 and CVE-2023-41266 targeting Qlik Sense to its catalog of exploited vulnerabilities.

Researchers from Aqua Security discover a new variant of the HeadCrab malware, adding infected devices to a botnet for use in cryptomining and other attacks, which controls responses and has rootkit-like actions.

Researchers from Fortinet identify an email phishing campaign using deceptive booking information to entice victims into clicking on a malicious PDF file. The PDF downloads a .NET executable file created with PowerGUI and then runs a PowerShell script to fetch the final malware, known as MrAnon Stealer.
Researchers from Check Point discover a phishing campaign delivering the maliicious phishing page via Genial.ly, a platform where users can create interactive content.
CompleteCare Health Network (CCHN) files a notice of data breach after discovering that the company was the recent victim of a ransomware attack.
Financial Risk Mitigation (FRM) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized actor was able to gain access to its computer system.

Author: UAC-0050
Description: Ukrainian and Polish authorities are the targets of a campaign from the threat actor tracked as UAC-0050, delivering the RemcosRAT and MeduzaStealer malware strains.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Hunters International
Description: The Hunters International ransomware gang claims to be behind a cyberattack on the Fred Hutchinson Cancer Center (Fred Hutch) that resulted in patients receiving personalized extortion threats.

Author: Rhysida
Description: The ransomware group Rhysida claims to have stolen a massive catalog from the German game developer Travian Games, with nearly 800,000 files that comprise 560GB of data.
The University of Wollongong discloses a security breach.

UnitedHealthcare Services (UHC) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access an email account belonging to Equality Health, an Accountable Care Organization that serves some UHC members.

VNS Health (VNS Health Home Care, VNS Health Hospice Care, and VNS Health Personal Care in New York) notify patients that an unauthorized third party gained access to the email accounts of some of its employees and potentially viewed or obtained some of their protected health information.

Author: Forest Blizzard a.k.a. APT28, Fancy Bear, Strontium, Fighting Ursa, TA422, ITG05
Description: Researchers from IBM X-Force discover a new campaign from the Russian threat actor APT28, leveraging the ongoing Israel-Hamas war to facilitate the delivery of the Headlace backdoor.
Country: AU AZ BE DE HU IT KZ LT PL RO SA TR UA

Description: The Kaunas University of Technology is hit with a cyber attack.

Author: BianLian
Description: Akumin is the victim of a ransomware attack from the BianLian group.

Author: Knight
Description: The Knight ransomware gang claims to have breached the city of Defiance.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Target: Italian Istituto Poligrafico e Zecca dello Stato (IPZS)
Description: The Italian Istituto Poligrafico e Zecca dello Stato (IPZS) (State Mint and Polygraphic Institute) falls victim of a BEC scam and sends 3 million Euros (3.23 million USD) in Hungary.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Lazarus a.k.a. Diamond Sleet, ZINC, Labyrinth Chollima
Target: Manufacturing, agricultural, and physical security companies worldwide.
Description: Researchers from Cisco Talos discover a new campaign conducted by the Lazarus Group called “Operation Blacksmith,” exploiting the CVE-2021-44228 Log4J vulnerability, and employing at least three new DLang-based malware families: NineRAT, DLRAT, and BottomLoader.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Sophos decides to backport a security update for CVE-2022-3236 for end-of-life (EOL) firewall firmware versions after discovering hackers actively exploiting the flaw in attacks.

Target: Unnamed set-top box provider in UAE
Description: A group of threat actors targets a television service in the United Arab Emirates, replacing the original broadcast with graphic footage from the war between Israel and Hamas.

Author: Cyber Av3ngers
Target: Private group water scheme in the rural Erris area of County Mayo
Description: Residents of a remote area on Ireland’s west coast are left without water due to a cyberattack perpetrated by the pro-Iran group Cyber Av3ngers.

Author: Medusa
Description: The Medusa ransomware gang claims responsibility for an attack to Glendale Unified School District (GUSD) and leaks dozens of sensitive documents.

Author: Medusa
Description: The Medusa ransomware gang claims responsibility for an attack to Glendale Unified School District and lists the victim in their website.

A cyberattack at Newsquest, one of the UK’s largest regional media groups, has disrupted operations at its local news outlets, causing intermittent website outages and leaving journalists unable to file stories.

Author: Threat actors from China, Iran, and Russia
Description: The FBI, the CIA, the NSA, the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) and the Office of the Director of National Intelligence (ODNI) confirm they detected evidence of foreign interference during the 2022 US federal elections through multiple attack techniques such as DDoS, scanning of federal websites, etc.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Target: Professionals at companies in Saudi Arabia
Description: A new campaign is using hundreds of fake profiles on LinkedIn to target professionals at companies in Saudi Arabia, not only for financial fraud, but to convince employees in specific roles to provide sensitive corporate information.
CareTree files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized actor was able to access the CareTree platform
TRISTAR Insurance Group (TRISTAR) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access its computer network through a cyberattack.
HealthAlliance files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party had gained access to the organization’s IT network.
Kyivstar, Ukraine's largest telecommunications service provider serving over 25 million mobile and home internet subscribers, suffers a cyberattack impacting mobile and data services.

Author: Ukraine's defense intelligence directorate (GUR)
Description: Ukraine's defense intelligence directorate (GUR) says it infected thousands of servers belonging to Russia's state tax service (Russian Federal Taxation Service - FNS) with malware, and destroyed databases and backups.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Multiple threat actors including Storm-1283
Description: Researchers from Microsoft warn that financially-motivated threat actors are using OAuth applications to automate BEC and phishing attacks, push spam, and deploy VMs for cryptomining.

ESO Solutions, a provider of software products for healthcare organizations and fire departments, discloses that data belonging to 2.7 million patients has been compromised as a result of a ransomware attack.
The central bank of southern African country Lesotho is facing severe outages due to a cyberattack that was discovered earlier this week.
The District Court of March, in Switzerland, announces it was “the victim of a cyber attack,” likely ransomware.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Rhysida
Description: Grupo José Alves is listed by the Rhysida ransomware group.

Author: TA4557
Description: Researchers from Proofpoint discover a new campaign by the Russian threat actor TA4557 mimicking job applicants via email to siphon off valuable data from prospective employers.

Author: Meow
Description: The Meow ransomware gang claims to have breached the Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (MSKCC.)

Researchers from ESET discover a cluster of malicious Python projects being distributed in PyPI, the official Python package repository, targeting both Windows and Linux systems and usually delivers a custom backdoor. In some cases, the final payload is a variant of the infamous W4SP Stealer.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: The LockBit 3.0 ransomware gang targets  the Italian cloud service provider Westpole, which is specialized in digital services for public administration. The incident impacts PA Digitale, the government agency that offers services to various local and government organizations.
Keenan & Associates (Kennan) files a notice of data breach after discovering that it was the recent victim of a ransomware attack.
Regional Family Medicine files a notice of data breach after discovering that what initially appeared to be an IT outage was really a cyberattack.

Target: Southern Illinois Healthcare - Harrisburg Medical Center
Description: Southern Illinois Healthcare - Harrisburg Medical Center (SIH HMC) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unknown and unauthorized party was able to access its computer network.
Cardiothoracic and Vascular Surgeons (CTVS) files a notice of data breach after discovering that information on the company’s computer network was subject to unauthorized access.

Health Diagnostic Management (HDM), a provider of non-medical management services for diagnostic imaging centers, discloses a breach of its patient portal after valid credentials for a referring physician from Brooklyn Premiere Orthopedics were used to access the patient portal.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Researchers from Shadowserver reveal that threat actors are attempting to leverage a recently fixed critical vulnerability (CVE-2023-50164) in Apache Struts that leads to remote code execution, in attacks that rely on publicly available proof-of-concept exploit code.

Author: APT29 a.k.a. the Dukes, CozyBear, and NOBELIUM/Midnight Blizzard
Description: The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA), U.S. National Security Agency (NSA), Polish Military Counterintelligence Service (SKW), CERT Polska (CERT.PL), and the UK’s National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) warn that the APT29 hacking group linked to Russia's Foreign Intelligence Service (SVR) has been targeting unpatched JetBrains TeamCity servers in widespread attacks since September 2023.

Researchers from Abnormal Security discover a new wave of BazarCall attacks using Google Forms to generate and send payment receipts to victims, attempting to make the phishing attempt appear more legitimate.

Author: Volt Typhoon a.k.a. Bronze Silhouette
Description: Researchers from Black Lotus discover a campaign by the Chinese state-sponsored APT group known as Volt Typhoon (Bronze Silhouette) linked to a sophisticated botnet named 'KV-botnet' to attack SOHO routers in high-value targets.
The London Public Library in Ontario is forced to shut down most of its services due to a cyberattack.

Author: Rhysida
Description: Sony says it is looking into reports of a ransomware attack on its subsidiary Insomniac Games, the studio behind popular titles like Spider-Man, Spyro the Dragon and more, after claims by the Rhysida ransomware gang.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: CMS, one of the world’s largest law firms, is claimed by the LockBit 3.0 ransomware, with the attackers alleging a 500GB data theft.

Author: Hunters International
Description: Hunters International claims responsibility for a ransomware attack to Covenant Care.

Author: Cactus
Description: Petersen Health Care suffers a Cactus ransomware attack.

Author: DragonForce
Description: DragonForce adds Greater Cincinnati Behavioral Health Services (GCBHS) to its leak site, claiming to have exfiltrated 72.4 GB of files.
Decentralized exchange OKX falls victim to a hack after a private key belonging to the proxy admin owner is leaked. Total losses amount to approximately $2.7 million.

Author: Meow
Description: The Tulane University is hit with a cyber attack. The Meow ransomware gang claims respomsibility.
The Ledger hardware wallet warns users that a supply chain attack on the 'Ledger dApp Connect Kit' library was found pushing a JavaScript wallet drainer that stole $600,000 in crypto and NFTs.
Researchers from Zimperium discover ten new Android banking malware families, which collectively target 985 bank and fintech/trading apps from financial institutes across 61 countries.

Target: Organizations in Mexico, Colombia and Vietnam
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky discover a novel Go-based malware named NKAbuse, which primarily targets Linux desktops in Mexico, Colombia, and Vietnam, abusing the NKN (New Kind of Network) peer-to-peer technology for data exchange.

Author: Snatch
Description: The Kraft Heinz Company says it is looking into recent claims of data theft made by the Snatch ransomware gang.

Author: Storm-0539,
Description: Researchers from Microsoft observe a significant surge in activity associated with the threat actor Storm-0539, known to target retail organizations for gift card fraud and theft using highly sophisticated email and SMS phishing during the holiday shopping season.

Author: China
Description: The Australian Strategic Policy Institute (ASPI) reveals the details of 'Shadow Play,' a new influence campaign pushing pro-China and anti-United States narratives on at least 30 YouTube channels.

Author: APT34 a.k.a. OilRig
Description: Researchers from ESET discover a new campaign from the APT34 cyber-espionage group linked to the Iranian government against organizations in Israel and leveraging several new malware downloaders: ODAgent, OilCheck and OilBooster.

Author: GambleForce
Target: 20 victims primarily located in Australia, China, Indonesia, the Philippines, India, South Korea, Thailand, and Brazil.
Description: Researchers from Group-IB uncover GambleForce, a previously unknown group that uses simple and dated attack methods to target governments and businesses in the Asia-Pacific region.
Country: AU BR CN ID KR PH TH

Author: Chinese Threat Actors
Description: Researchers from Uptycs uncover a phishing campaign targeting the United States Postal Service (USPS) with more than 1,400 live phishing websites discovered globally, potentially linked to Chinese threat actors.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Researchers from Chainalysis reveal that threat actors have been leveraging approval phishing scams to steal at least $1BN in cryptocurrency since May 2021 ($374M so far in 2023.)

Author: TA402 a.k.a. Molerats, Gaza Cybergang, Frankenstein, WIRTE
Description: Researchers from SentinelOne discover a new campaign by the pro-Hamas threat actor known as Gaza Cybergang, targeting Palestinian entities using Pierogi++, an updated version of a backdoor dubbed Pierogi.

Author: 8220 gang
Description: Researchers from Imperva detect previously undocumented activity from the 8220 gang, exploiting the CVE-2020-14883, Remote Code Execution vulnerability in Oracle WebLogic Server.
Personal and health data belonging to approximately 10,000 people is illegally downloaded from the genetic testing company Asper Biogene’s database.
Researchers from Mandiant identify an UNC2975 malvertising campaign presented to users in sponsored search engine results and social media posts, distributing DarkGate and Danabot.
AMCP Payments Intermediate Company d/b/a Talus Pay files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party had gained access to an employee email account.

Author: Qilin
Description: Neurology Center of Nevada is allegedly attacked by the Qilin ransomware gang.
Parking app developer EasyPark publishes a notice on its website warning of a data breach it discovered on December 10, 2023, which impacts an unknown number of its millions of users.
American global apparel and footwear giant VF Corporation, the owner of brands like Supreme, Vans, Timberland, and The North Face, discloses a security incident that caused operational disruptions.

Author: 8Base
Description: Researchers from Resecurity discover a joint extortion campaign where the BianLian, White Rabbit, and Mario ransomware gangs are collaborating targeting publicly-traded financial services firms.
Researchers from Malwarebytes discover a new malvertising campaign delivering the PikaBot malware via malicious search ads.
Newfound Area School District is recovering from a ransomware attack.

Author: Sidewinder (a.k.a. Rattlesnake, BabyElephant, APT Q4, APT Q39, Hardcore Nationalist, HN2, RAZOR Tiger, and GroupA21)
Description: Researchers from Cyfirma discover a malicious campaign by the threat actor known as Sidewinder targeting Nepalese government officials via the Nim backdoor.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Kahua files a notice of data breach after discovering that the company had fallen victim to a ransomware attack.

Coos Health & Wellness (CHW) discloses a security breach ùthat may have involved personal and protected health information belonging to individuals who received services at various programs that CHW supports.
